issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Movie of the test is attached.
I tested thins on MAC in FF 24. I logged in to user account and navigated to Volumes Landing page from Dashboard. Volumes show up without a name.
Navigating to Dashboard and back causes the name to appear.

This affects automated testing.
fields.summary: Resource name does not appear after initial log in

comments.body:
[~jpommer]: EUCA-7732 will probably be resolved when this issue is resolved.  

Feel free to pick either 7768 or 7732 to address this issue.  Both are marked blockers atm.

/cc [~alice]

[~kgill], [~alice] - I see that the names do appear after a delay of about 15 seconds, consistently. You'll sit there and watch, and after that delay you see the push come in from the proxy, which triggers an update on the table.

[~dkavanagh] - Any idea why the proxy is continually pushing the subject of whatever landing page you're on (in 15 second intervals), though it doesn't appear any updates are in the set? It's like we're back to polling again.

While I think this behavior isn't ideal and should be fixed, I recommend that this issue and EUCA-7732 be downgraded from blockers to something less severe.

That said, I will see what more I can find out.
Ah, it's sockjs triggering the update every 15 seconds. Even on clients that support websockets. So we are back to polling?

[~dkavanagh] - More info: Bottom line is that the proxy is returning an empty collection for tags at start of day. If you put a breakpoint in models/tags.js sync you can see it return nothing, nothing, nothing.... even with a manual fetch() from the debugger. Then sometime later it starts returning tags. That's why you do get the names after that 15 second delay.

Do we know why tags aren't populated in the proxy (cache?) at start of day, and why they lazily come in later?

All - uncovered some other problems while looking into this. Started a branch for this bug and put fixes for that stuff in it:

https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucalyptus-console/compare/testing...EUCA-7768

[~jpommer], Please watch the movie I attached to EUCA-7732. If one does not navigate away from the landing page, the name never shows up (I waited for 3 minutes). I could  reproduce the bug manually on a freshly built setup or immediately after log in. I don't think you can reliably reproduce the issue on a setup that has been in use for a while, that's why you have seen updates every 15 seconds. This is the expected behavior and would not break the tests. Volume name not showing for 2+ minutes is a blocking issue for all our automated tests that are triggered by pull request as there is always a fresh setup built at first.
[~alice] - Okay. Do you have such a setup created already that I can access and see what might be different about the two?

Hi [~jpommer], I just built a setup https://10.111.5.67:8888  If you log in as ui-test-acct-00/user00 you an see the two volumes that I created. I named them in the "Create volume" dialog. The names did not show up for me at all this time even after a long wait and clicking around.  When I looked in the firebug I did not see any evidence that the name tag was created at all. 

Here is the system link to the setup. http://10.111.1.120/euca-qa/display_test.php?testname=alice-ui-test-new&uid=1025&prev_page=http%3A%2F%2F10.111.1.120%2Feuca-qa%2Fstart_test.php&Refresh=Refresh

[~jpommer], on the above setup I named a volume by adding name tag. Here are the steps to reproduce the issue of volume name not showing for 2+ minutes in Firefox:

1) log in to https://10.111.5.67:8888 as ui-test-acct-00/user00
2) click on volume count on dashboard 
3) wait for the Volumes landing page to load
The names of the named volumes never show up (I waited for 2+ minutes), when you navigate to dashboard and back to Volumes Landing Page again, you will see the names.
[~alice] - See attached flash video. I can't reproduce on your setup either. In fact your machine doesn't even have the 15 second delay. Names come up immediately. Sorry.

[~alice], [~jpommer]: I tried reproducing with 10.111.5.67 and ui-test-acct-00/user00 but couldn't.  
I see the volume name come up after about a half-second delay, tested in Safari 6 and FF 24 on Mac OS 10.8

HI [~kgill],  we can lower the status of this bug for now, but I would like to test it on a freshly built setup after naming volume during creation is fixed. 

I was seeing this issue on a fresh build and would like to investigate a bit more before we close it.
I see a very long (15 second) delay for names of instances to show up. Just pulled latest from testing this morning.

[~aliceh] - Don't know why I couldn't reproduce this on volumes yesterday, but I definitely see it today, and this fix takes care of it:

https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucalyptus-console/pull/129
Reassigned to [~dkavanagh] so we can get this merged sooner.  Although the build test failed, I think merging this should help other pull requests pass the build (--at least let's hope so).
